review: Dear travelingforsanity,  Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your time in Fort Lauderdale and in our Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East. I’ve shared your compliments with the staff, which is always a great way to motivate them!   Thank you again! We hope to have the pleasure of accommodating you in the near future!   Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: Not bad
review: We stayed here for one night pre-cruise. From Ft. Lauderdale airport to this hotel will run you about a $40 cab ride one way. We were under the impression that this hotel was much closer to the airport. Although the hotel has a shuttle van, it will only take you around to close proximities. Not to the airport or port. If you ask the front desk for a recommended shuttle service to take you to the port, you can pre-book a van the night prior to pick you up the morning of your cruise for about $30. Make sure you reserve the earliest pick up time to take this shuttle to the port in case they need to drop off guests at other ships. The port gets VERY crowded.  Hotel renovations (as mentioned in previous posts on this thread) have been completed for the most part. Check in was…

title: NEEDS RENEWING BUT VERY GOOD NEVERTHELESS
review: Quiet rooms on a busy street.  The buffet   breakfast not to be missed.  9.95$  Probably best breakfast deal in Ft., Lauderdale.  Hotel close to Lauderdale by the Sea, with its cosy cafes and restaurants a must beach to visit..  Surely this hotel will be renewed compltely as they have done with other courtyards, but in the meantime its a very good hotel for your stay in Ft.  Lauderdale.

title: Good place to stay for overnight needs
review: We stayed at this hotel during our way to a Cruise and went we returned back.  The rooms are clean and good size.  The service was ok but nothing out of the extraordinary.  This hotel has no shuttle to/from the Airport or the Cruise terminal.  Their shuttle service is for a 3 mile radius but there is not much you can do within that distance. Although not a luxery hotel it serves the purpose of an overnight stay.

title: Just don't...
review: It's one of the old style courtyards in a bad neighborhood with a $10 buffet breakfast. There's a note in the room that says they'll be "under construction for remodel for the next several weeks" dated August 24th. Now, 4 and a half months later, it's not remodeled at all and is a very dated property. The staff is very nice but it doesn't make up for the property.

title: Don't expect Marriott service.  Other than that- "fine"
review: Dear Boywhocouldfly21, Thank you for your review! I am sorry your impression of our hotel was not a positive one.  In deed our renovation has taken quite a bit longer than originally anticipated due to the complex nature of the project and some unexpected bumps on the road. The hotel is undergoing a full property improvement plan that includes not only updating the room décor, but completely replacing the bathrooms, installing lavish showers and walk-in closets, and a full hallway makeover with bright white doors and enhanced lighting for a truly refreshing experience. In addition, our entire lobby and meeting space will be transformed! The challenge is to do all this work while minimizing the impact it has on our in-house guests! Thanks to your feedback, we have revised the renovation notice in the rooms to better reflect our current timeline.  We are excited to share that our 5th floor has been completed and the feedback from our guests has been outstanding!  Slowly but surely we are making our Courtyard a gem in Fort Lauderdale’s eastside. I truly hope that during your next visit to Fort Lauderdale you have a chance to stop by to see the latest improvements and get a warm smile for our lovely staff!  Kindest regards, Rob Lewis

title: Great location and even better staff!
review: After 8 days in the Keys we came back up to Ft. Lauderdale before catching a flight back !  north.  We selected the Courtyard East and was glad we did!  The room was nice overlooking the pool.  After inquiring about dinner location recommendations, the front desk mentioned That traffic and parking on Saturday night at the beach was problematic and suggested that their van could take us to dinner and we could call when we needed a ride back.  We'll stay here again!

title: A work in progress
review: This hotel is undergoing a major renovation project at this time. The top 2 floors of the hotel are closed and construction was underway, but was only minimally disruptive. The renovation is way behind schedule as it was supposed to be complete by December 31, but I would estimate they are less than 25% done. When I stayed here last year at this time, the renovations were supposed to start shortly after. The bathroom sink smelled musty, but I would hope the renovations to fix that problem. The rooms have very small refrigerators and no microwaves, surprising for a Courtyard. One nice side effect of the delayed work is that the full Courtyard Cafe is still in operation, it will unfortunately be replaced by the "Bistro" when work is complete. Possibly due to the construction…

title: Gross...
review: I have stayed at Courtyards, Holiday Inn Express, Hampton Inn's all over the country and this was one of the worst, by far.  The hotel is old and musty right out of the 1980s.  While the rooms looked somewhat clean there was a disgusting moldy/musty smell throughout.  The carpets, furniture, and elevator made me nauseous, along with the overall feel of the place.  I don't know how Marriott let them use their name, but it makes me think twice about staying at one of their other hotels.  As of right now, I wouldn't let my mother-in-law sleep in this place

title: Highly recommended!
review: My gf and I just returned home to Montreal,Canada after staying 5 nights (August 22-26,2012),at The Courtyard. Staff was extremely helpful,especially with the mysterious clogging toilet lol! They cleared it 3 times,and after each phone call,there were up to the room within minutes! Pool and whirlpool were both great,location perfect,Denny's across the street,Dunkin Donuts,Starbucks,within a few minutes walk down the other street. Breakfast at the hotel was amazing,chefs were very friendly!The hotel is currently being renovated on the 4th and 5th floors,but only during the daytime will you hear the construction noise. We had a car rental,so leaving for the beach and even to Miami,we seemed to be perfectly located! Again,a very big and appreciative thank you to all the staff and…

title: Not up to Courtyard by Marriott standards
review: This hotel has a good feel to it but we were still disappointed. We expect more than this from a Courtyard by Marriott. Only stay here if you get a good price.  The room seemed clean but the towels had foul dirty spots on them. Sounds from the corridor outside the room could easily be heard and the noise from the ice machine was annoying.  The price during our stay was about $ 110 per night.

title: Excellent Hotel Close To Everything in Ft Lauderdale
review: I recently stayed at this hotel which I had stayed at previously for business travel.  Upon arrival I was greeted by a very friendly staff and they accomodated my request to get a room pool side.  Upon arriving at my room it was in excellent condition.  The room was very clean with a fresh smell.  The bathroom was spotless you could not ask for a cleaner bathroom at any hotel.  The wifi worked very well during my entire 3 day stay.  They have a nice workout room, refreshing pool and hot tub,  Their location is close to several good restuarants and is close by to the Wilton Manors neighborhood.  I enjoyed having a hot breakfast with cooked to order eggs both mornings during my stay.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and goes above and beyond to ensure guest have  wonderful…

title: Good Quick Business Stay
review: I chose this property because it was extremely close to a business meeting that I was required to attend and not because a marriott Courtyard would normally be my first choice of hotel.  While the accomodations were standard for this type of property, my rook was clean and well kept.  In addition, I cannot say enough about the staff.  They were friendly and went out of their way to be accomodating.  If I find myself back in the area, I would stay again.

title: Not up to the usual standards we expect from Courtyard Marriott
review: This is an older hotel - which would be OK, but it really needs new carpets and paint. The rooms were clean, but the carpet slightly - tacky - not nice. The staff were super nice and it was a good location for me

title: Just like home
review: This hotel exceeds expectations. from the housekeeping to the front desk. they are all very accomodating and nice to be around. Room was great. i stayed here for three weeks, so i should be pretty qualified to review this place.

title: Good stay!
review: Overall, it was a good stay: easy reservations, Marriott friends and family discount, fast check in, great location, friendly staff. Complimentary very good quality coffee was a great deal. Apples and bananas were a nice touch too.Gym is very small, but serves it purpose. Complimentary safe deposit box came very useful. We checked out 15 minutes later check out time, and no one bothered us to find out when we r checking out.Everything was very good, except the cleanliness of the carpet in the room.

title: Great location, great staff!
review: Tried this hotel for the first time recently. The staff is outstanding; very welcoming and helpful. Loved having a balcony in my room. The location is just great for getting around Broward County.  Free shuttle to area restaurants; great internet; breakfast buffet.

title: review of the quality of our stay at this property
review: We were very satisfied with both the efficiency and quality of the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East.  The staff was courteous and the services of the housekeeping and kitchen were superior!   The only suggestion is that a fence or other soundproofing device might be build around the pool area.   I would certainly return to this facility.

title: Great service and personal touches
review: I came to Fort Lauderdale to take a class with Immersion Freediving.  Immersion Freediving has a deal with this particular Marriott and I received a discount on my stay.  It was so nice to come into the hotel and find a card and water specifically set aside for me, as someone with Immersion Freediving, welcoming me to the hotel.  In addition, I left my phone charger in my hotel room, and the Marrott FedExed it to me free of charge after I left, and I received it the very next day.  Excellent service, highly recommended.  The staff at the breakfast area are also very nice and helpful.

title: Relaxing.
review: It was a nice, clean and a quiet place and the front service was great!

title: June
review: Excellent hotel, 10 minute walk from beach, spacious clean rooms, brilliant staff, couldn't ask for nicer and more friendly people, so so helpful would help in any way they could. Free transport from hotel within a 3 mile radius, breakfast was brilliant. Great place, definitely recommended.

title: Great experience time after time!
review: The staff, location, and rooms are all outstanding.  The price is very competitive for updated rooms with the new comfortable bedding, flat screen TV, and nice clean carpet.  The complex is small but very charming.  The gym is tiny but has what you need for a quick workout.  If you don't want to drive 5 minutes to the beach you can enjoy on-site pool.  Walk across the street to Denny's for a quick snack.  Location location location, excellent staff, clean environment, and great price.  Enjoy.

title: experience at Courtyard Marriott , Fort Laud.
review: Alll went well; accomodations were excellent; the only mar was the partying next door until the wee hours of the morning; not your fault  we chose not to complain thinking they must have had good reason to party

title: Best Marriott to accomplish business & pleasure within 1-4 miles!
review: The staff, location, rooms and business access are all OUTSTANDING.  Free, high speed wireless internet that really is high speed is greatly appreciated.  The pool area is large, clean and flexible enough that there are both quiet and party spots.  Great restaurants, multiple banks, THE OCEAN are all within a mile........HIGHLY RECOMMEND and WILL RETURN!

title: Nice Accomodation - Reasonably Priced
review: Room was nice, clean and well equipped. Front desk people were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast in the morning was not comlimentary as I thought it would be, but, the food was good. Not within walking distance of any good restaurants. .

title: Comfy beds
review: I am usually not disappointed in Marriott properties, and this hotel was no exception. Rooms were clean, comfy beds, nice large balconies, good location. The hotel is starting to show some wear and needs updating. Pool area needs some sprucing up as well.

title: Great Service!
review: My Mom and I stayed at the "Courtyard by Marriott Fort Lauderdale East" because it was the closest hotel to Holy Cross Hospital.  We were there to visit my sister in the hospital. Saturday night,I left the hospital around 7PM but my Mom was going to stay until 8:30.  I requested a pick-up for her in the hotel van at 8:30PM.  My Mom is 81 years old and not used to traveling alone so I went down to the lobby to wait for her at 8:25PM.  Mary, who was working at the desk, was walking out toward her car but recognized me and told me the van driver had gotten lost on "A1A" and she was going to pick up my Mom.  Would I like to come?  We drove over to the hospital and got my Mom.  I am so grateful to Mary for going out of her way to assure my Mom had a ride back at the expected time.  I…

title: Clean and Friendly
review: We have stayed here numerous occassions.  Never stay on the 1st floor as the center hallway is slate and when people enter or leave with their roll on luggage it resounds.  This time we stayed on the 4th floor, as they did not have a King available on the 5th....the way the building is constructed if people above are not careful about the noise they make walking or dropping luggage etc is easily disturbing.  We had noise above and when we called the front desk they immediately looked into it and the noise stopped.  Breakfast was delicious as they have a limited buffet, but the chef prepares fresh egg dishes upon request.  Dining room server--older hispanic gentleman--very friendly and helpful.  We will stay again, but will insist on the top floor...Location is great, and people…

title: Decent for the price
review: Good service and decent rooms. It was somewhat annoying to be charged $10 for breakfast when other bargain chains include it in the room price. I like that the hotel is well located near the beach.

title: Items Stolen, Daily Deductions and Everyday Toilet Plunging!
review: My partner and I arrived at the Courtyard by Marriott - Fort Lauderdale East on saturday, 14th April 2012.    We checked into the hotel after having a few issues at the front desk re: the monies that would be deducted each day from my Barclays Bank current account. I was told that it is "Marriott Policy" to deduct US$20 PER DAY for sundries. A policy that was in no way detailed in the booking information. I booked via Expedia and read the details VERY carefully. I said that this was VERY unusual practice. I DO understand completely the practice of a hotel registering ones credit card details in case of sundries BUT to ACTUALLY deduct monies each day off of the card is something completely unheard of in my experience as a world traveller. I was asked with whom I made the booking.…

title: Very pleased with Courtyard Marriott in Ft Lauderdale, FL.
review: Dear Michelle C, I understand it can be very unsettling to lose family photos and valuable items and am truly sorry for your experience. I appreciate you contacting me directly after your week-long stay with us, since we take these matters very seriously. Immediately after our conversation, we read the room locks and the record showed that there was no unauthorized entry from the time of your arrival until the housekeeper cleaned the room at 3pm the following day. As discussed over the phone, I recommended you report the situation to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department and offered to assist you in that process. We have received your letter detailing the incident and have forwarded to our headquarters for review. The response will be sent to your e-mail, for privacy matters.  I apologize for the confusion upon check-in regarding the additional authorization of funds. It is common practice for hotels to authorize a determined additional amount on credit cards upon arrival to cover incidental charges. This is the same process with debit cards, but in this case it engages the funds, until the hold is released a few days later. This is why we notify our guests in advance during the check-in process. In this particular case, when our Front Desk Manager called your bank internationally, she was informed that they did not have a hold on your debit card for additional funds.  Your observations were also shared with our Housekeeping Team and appropriate disciplinary action was taken. Please forgive us for providing you with a sleeping room that was less than perfect.  Kindest regards, Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: It was OK
review: We always try to stay in Marriott hotels as we have Marrriott reward points.  The price on this one wasn't too bad for this time of year (April) - it was $110 plus tax but that didn't include breakfast.  They did have coffee 24  hours a day in the lobby.  The personnel were nice but we didn't feel that the hotel was up to usual Courtyard standards.  Not a great location - corner of U.S. 1 and Commercial but it was handy as we were visiting family who were staying at the Wyndham Palm Aire.

title: Excellent hotel!!
review: I used this hotel as the host hotel for my wedding in April. For the area it was in and the proximity to the beach, it was affordable and convenient. My guests were very pleased with their rooms and they thoroughly enjoyed the hot breakfast!! The staff was very courteous and the facility was very clean. Brea Strager was the absolute best person to work with in the midst of wedding chaos and I have no regrets about my decision!

title: Everything perfect except the Internet
review: Although we were told by the hotel that the serious Internet problem they have will be fixed soon,  I am convinced that my email account  was hacked while staying there.  I was able to get on their wi-fi Internet for short periods of time, after multiple attempts each time.  We did notify hotel of problem and they were aware of it.  The hotel was the only place that my account could have been hacked - all the entries in my address list were sent an email from a hacker.  Other than the Internet problem, I really liked the hotel.

title: Great Value - Great stay
review: Close to the airport - near great restaurants - staff great.

title: Door Slamming Hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel.It looked nice with fresh comfortable beds and was clean but, around 8 in the morning the doors started to slam.This is an older hotel with spring loaded doors. If you plan on sleeping in then do not stay there.If you like doors slamming as your alarm them do so.

title: Nice rooms, friendly staff
review: I stayed here for two evenings for a visit with an uncle in nearby Lauderdale-by-the-Sea. Very convenient to the beach, US1, restaurants, and shopping. Quiet room and friendly staff. Would stay here again.

title: Ft Lauderdale Stay
review: This is our third stay at this Courtyard Marriott.  We have been well pleased with the service and enjoy the buffet breakfasts daily.  The grounds are well kept, the rooms are clean, and the pool is nice.  There is always plenty of parking and this hotel is a short drive from the airport, beach, and shopping.  There is always complimentary lemon water and coffee in the lobby.  We will return to this hotel on our next trip to visit family.

title: Courtyard Ft. Lauderdale East
review: I try to stay here when I am in the area. Great front desk staff!! Very helpful and friendly and recognize me when I walk in the front door which makes you feel good! Breakfast in the restaurant is much better quality! Nice fitness room as well. Convenient to the interstate and several great area restaurants! Can be a little pricey in the winter months but not out of line with other local hotels.

title: Court Yart Marriott Ft. Lauderdale
review: Great Location---convenient to everything and everyone we know. Front Desk very Friendly and took care of any needs we might have had. Thank you We will be back!!!

title: Great Stay
review: We always stay at this Courtyard when in Lauderdale, because it is close to our family.  The staff is always so nice (and usually the same people, there’s very little turnover).  Our rooms were very clean and the beds had a nice pillow top and new bedding!  Housekeeping had the rooms down each morning, by the time we returned form breakfast!  The pool area is nice and clean.  You can hear some cars from Federal Highway, sometimes, but with my kids I usually don’t (over they yelling in the pool, apologies to the other guests).  Excellent breakfast at the buffet.  We’ll miss that after they renovated to the new Courtyard style (front desk said this summer).

title: Nice room great service
review: We found this property to be clean and well maintained inside and out. The rooms were very nice. We had a room that overlooked the balcony. No seating on the balcony though. The staff we encountered were all very nice and friendly. We had a problem with our reservation, but the front desk quickly found a resolution that was satisfactory to us.  I would stay here again.

title: Quick to the Beach,Clean and Friendly Sefvice
review: This is the 4th or 5th time we have stayed at the property, the staff is always attentive, the food service for breakfast is great and the location is perfect for us. We are also happy that you were able to put us into the poolside room 109 which we requested

title: Great Location in ft. Lauderdale
review: When in Ft. Lauderdale, as a business traveler in town often, I always stay at the Courtyard East on the corner of Federal and Commercial. Great location near the beach, many great restaurants and shopping. Staff is first class, they remember my name and always try to make me feel comfy knowing that I'm always on the road. Try Joe's omlettes and biscuits and gravy in the restaurant!!

title: Worst night ever!
review: Dear Gary K,  Thank you very much for your loyalty and for taking the time to write a great review for our hotel.  We are thrilled to know that you enjoy your stays at the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East. It means the world to us.  We are looking forward to seeing you again soon! And, we’ll do everything we can to give you a room overlooking the pool on a high floor!   Kindest regards,  Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: Good service
review: Yes - the staff was nice, however - the toilet seat was not cleaned, there was a hair on my hand towel, there was a hair on my shower curtain, there were ants on the dresser, the exercise room had a worm crawling on the wall and some of the equipment and attached TVs did not work.  Also, there was a mosquito or several mosquitos that attacked me the entire night, so by the time i got in the morning, I had about 10 bites all over my face!  This hotel is old and creepy, and I will never stay there again.

title: My first trip to Ft. Lauderdale
review: Besides the elevator being VERY VERY SLOW, and this property would not allow a 2:00 PM late checkout (being a gold member I have never had this issue), everything else was as expected for a Courtyard - I mean this in a positive way.

title: 2 Night Stay
review: Nice place. Large room. Easy to find. Convenient to the beach.  Did not spend much time there as we had planned activities all weekend.

title: Spring break
review: I was staying here with my mum for a few nights in March 2012. The room was clean, spacious, bathroom was okay, too, balcony large enough, beds very very comfortable. :-) Personel very friendly and helpful. Big PRO - free wi-fi internet.

title: We'll be back, and with our family and friends.
review: There were a couple of issues that were frustrating, but once properly addressed were quickly resolved to our complete satisfaction. Breakfast was very good, with a wide choice of options. The hotel's location was great, convenient to many good restaurants and easy access to tourist sights.  We plan to return next year for our family reunion and I plan to strongly suggest we make this Courtyard our hotel.

title: Courtyard by Marriott Ft. Lauderdale East
review: We stayed at this property post cruise and found it to be in exceptional condition.    The facitly was very nice and a great location.    We will definately stay here again.

title: Not owned by Marriott, and it shows.
review: Staying in town for a wedding, we stayed here for two nights. Our first night, we were so tired when we got in we just crashed on the bed without really checking out the room. While trying to get ready the next morning however, we noticed that the toilet didn't flush, the refrigerator didn't work, and the iron's water well leaked. I left a note and a sizable tip for housekeeping to please have the problems fixed or replaced by the time we got back later that evening.  When we returned, nothing had been fixed, though the tip was certainly gone. Called the front desk, who sent up the night repair guy, who said he couldn't fix anything that was wrong that night. We ended up changing rooms and getting extra rewards points and a comp'ed breakfast for our troubles. (To be fair, our…

title: Pictures on Website need to be CHANGED!
review: Dear Sam P, Thank you for choosing our hotel and for taking the time to post a review. There is no excuse! Your room should have been in perfect condition in the first place, but at the very least, we should have rectified the issues immediately. I truly apologize for your inconveniences. I have addressed this with our housekeeping and maintenance teams and we discussed ways to improve the communication between departments to ensure our high standards of quality are consistently met.   Your perception of our brand is crucial and we do hope that our drive to please our guests (even after we dropped the ball) will lead you to reconsider.   Sincerely yours,  Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: We don't stay anywhere else when we are here!
review: This hotel is just okay. Very tired and old, but updated with fresh paint and a newer lobby. The rooms are off the lobby in a maze of courtyards, stairwells, and elevators (safety?). Our room was questionable as far as being very clean- it could have been the outdated and tired feeling that made it that way. The feeling is "old" motel.  The area is not the best, and I was 50% unsure of the safety of my car in their parking lot. Front desk employee at check-in was nice.  If you go to their website, please note that the photos seem to show a newer type hotel. I feel Marriott needs to update the photos.  Bottom line: This hotel may be great for college students on Spring break, or a family with budget concerns.  PROS: newer lobby, free newspaper, $9.95 breakfast (we didn't try it)…

title: Nice Property...met my expectations
review: Dear Foodiewest,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry you didn’t feel our photos represent our hotel. However, I can assure you that ALL the images in our online “Gallery” are recent and are specific to our unique property. There are a few non-specific stock photos used in the design of the site, which still apply to our hotel. The only one that does not, is the header under “Visit Local Area”, depicting a GoBoard, which we will have available soon. I have submitted a request to have this changed immediately to avoid any confusion. I apologize for missing this.   I am truly disappointed that you did not feel comfortable during your stay. We are located in a safe area in a good part of town, and have  well lit ample parking both in the front and back of the hotel.  As in the majority of Courtyards, a guest key is required to enter the building. Our guest room’s building structure is rectangular, with two elevators in the middle and stairways on both ends. I apologize our layout was not to your satisfaction. We are glad to that you did experience the warmth of our friendly staff!   Warmest regards,   Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: Our stay
review: When traveling to Fort Lauderdale to see my dad, my sisters and I choose to stay at the Courtyard Marriott on Federal Hgwy, for many reasons.  The staff is great and they go above and beyond to help satisfy our needs.  We have stayed here many times and believe it or not they remember us!  I hope people understand that this is not a five star hotel with all kinds of amenities, (although I've been in 5 star hotels that are not as enjoyable as it is here), but this surely fits our needs.  We had checked out another well known hotel chain when we were there last because of prices and curiosity, and I must say we will not stay anywhere else!  We are safe and are made to feel at home here. The breakfast is perfect and the staff is kind and friendly.   FYI...We stayed in a suite this…

title: Tired but okay
review: The location of this hotel looked better on a google map than in reality.  Not much near it and a huge traffic mess to get to it or away from it.  Lousy access to the parking lot.   Hotel is tired and so was the room compared to other Courtyards I stay at in similarly busy areas. Staff was great but the food was blech.  Even sub par to the regular "breakfast' at Courtyards.  The only positive is it's proximity to the beach.

title: Nice room...good service
review: Everyone was helpful. Room in good shape. Only complaint ...they charge 8.95 for a breakfast that is free at other comparable hotels.

title: close to the beach, slow computer
review: this is your standard marriott but its proximity to the beach makes it a good value hotel.  However, trying to use the internet was awful.  i gave up and just went to the airport early rather than try and wait for 20 minutes to print out my boarding pass

title: Average dated facility & not accommodating!
review: Even though we are Gold Marriott members, we were turned down when we asked if we could have a later checkout and a breakfast coupon.We stayed there 3 nights and my mom who is not even a Marriott member stayed one night and she was given a later check out time and free breakfast coupons.

title: Courtyard  Lauderdale by the Sea
review: Dear Sovereign, Thank you for your loyalty to Marriott! We appreciate your sharing your experience at our hotel. I am sorry we were not able to grant your wishes. Late departures are arranged based on availability, however, as a Gold Elite member, we should have accommodated your request. Our cooked- to-order breakfast buffet is a great value at only $9.95 per person. I am not certain of the reason for your mother receiving breakfast coupons, other than if the reservation was made under a “Stay for Breakfast” package, which includes it. Please accept my most sincere apologies for your inconvenience. Next time you are in Fort Lauderdale, I invite you to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com, and I will ensure we delight you as a cherished Marriott Rewards Elite Member.  Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: Good service
review: Room was clean, the emplyees were very helpfull, no complain

title: Courtyard by Marriott Fort Lauderdale East
review: I have stayed at this hotel twice this year and both times was pleased with the service.   The staff in the breakfast lobby was very professional, pleasant, and personable.  I highly recommend the breakfast ($10) which is well worth it considering you get made to order omlets, bacon, sausage, waffles, biscuits & gravy, fresh fruits, juices, and dairy.  I also recommend taking a trip to the local beach (Lauderdale by the Sea) which is only a mile and a half away and perfect for family activities (running, sun bathing, frisbee, etc).  This is definitely not a high-end luxury hotel but it is a very good value considering cost, convenience, and Marriott's style and standards.

title: Good location
review: Dear Chris N,  Thank you for a great review! We are thrilled that our hard work translates into satisfied customers! We are looking forward to serving you again soon!   Best wishes to you and your family,  Rob Lewis, General Manager

title: The Marriott name is very misleading
review: The location of the hotel was good, better than I expected. It wasn't far to the beach or the A1A strip. The airport was only about 20-25mins. The hotel can arrange a shuttle to the airport for a great price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Thanks Sharon and Reggie!

title: Staff was very rude!!!
review: We stayed at this hotel in Feb 2012. The staff was friendly at check in but that was about the last time I saw a smile and felt like I was a burden not an Elite Member. The internet was very very slow. I had dial up at one time that I truely believe was a little faster. We were given a lower floor room with a beautiful view of the parking lot. We were staying 6 day's and when we inquired about changing room's our request was denied and the the front desk help seemed offended. There was dust stuck to the ceiling from the air vent and stayed there for at least the length of our stay. Not sure how long it had been there before that. All the rooms had a balcony but if you went out on the balcony without shoes the botom of your feet were black. Not sure when the decks were cleaned…

title: Good bye to best part of Marriott Courtyards
review: This Courtyard has been the only location I stay at while on business trips to the Ft. Lauderdale area.  While the staff at check in is excellent and will do their very best to accomodate my request and the rooms are clean and comfortable, my favorite thing at the Courtyard is the breakfast buffet.  Unfortunately, Marroitt Corporate Headquarters has determined that they "have a better idea".   However, the "glorified Starbucks" being installed in all the Courtyard propertys is not it.  Therefore, I am being forced to seek other hotel accomodations throughout by business travel area, which is the entire Southeast and Southwest.  Good bye Marroitt Courtyards it has been a great and wonderful run the past 12 years.

title: Fine for business
review: The hotel staff is delightful at this hotel.  The hotel is not the most quiet place--doors slam loudly and noise can be heard between rooms.  The breakfast is good.  The pool area is right on a major 4-lane highway, so it is very loud.  This is hotel is fine for a quick business trip--I would not recommend it for a vacation.

title: Recent experience
review: Used our points for free room, so can't comment on value for money since we never asked what the rate was.  Nice clean big room with very comfortable beds.  Nice pool area.  Very accommodating - allowed us to check in at 9:30 AM (we had just gotten off a cruise and expected to ask to leave our luggage there until check in in the afternoon, but they gave us an available room).  Didn't like the lack of free breakfast (they have a full buffet for $9.99).

title: Fantastic Management and Front Desk
review: I was confused with my Marriott Rewards Points and my Visa Rewards Points, and the front desk and manager were so courteous and helpful in my reservations. I always stay here when I'm in the area, and I have always been very pleased. I use to work at this location when it was a Howard Johnson's in 1973, and I like staying here because I know my way around, and the staff are great, and even though the hotel could use a little upgrading, it is always very clean.

title: Poor customer service
review: The people at the front desk had very poor customer service skills. I had a issue where i had to print something on the computer so i was told or i couldnt get my room so as tried to print what i thought i needed the computer kept kicking me off. I told sharon was looked at me like i was crazy and told me to try the other computer, i did and it did the same thing. I told her again and ahe didnt once offer and assistance to see why i couldnt print anything. She had the nerve to tell me people print things from that computer all the time and it was a kinkos down the street.Sharon was actin as if she didn't even want to  help me fix the problem but you was quick to say that I couldn't get my room. I live in Maryland I drove over a thousand miles and had to deal with very poor…

title: Exceeded my expectations!
review: I was positively surprised when arriving to this hotel. I didn't have that high expectations and only ecpected it to be OK since we didn't plan to spend that much time at the hotel anyway. However, the weather turned out to be great and we spent some time by the pool. We also got a very good room on ground level with an exit towards the pool. The location was also very good, close to Everglades, Sawgrass Mills and a 20 minutes walk from the beach. It didn't matter that it was situated in an intersection since the sound insulation was very good. They had a good breakfast buffet with many people from outside the hotel as well. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.

title: no xbox or gaming console in the room using the TV
review: I found the rrom and the people to be very nice BUT this is the FRIST  hotel that i have stayed at , when asked why the TV input jacks are deactivated " ALL Court Yards are the same "  THIS is wrong I have stayed at alot of CY and other hotels which will do anything they can fix the issues in todays standards  of Hotels,. I will not stay at a CY  untill this is corrected. The people there were clueless and the tv ports should have been activated upond request no ceptions!!!!!!!

title: Ullimann
review: We were for just a few days in Lauderdale - by - Sea and found this place via booking.com. We found this a nice place, not to far from the beach. Plenty of parcing space, free Wi-Fi (which is not normal in Germany) and very quiet during the night, even with two mayor roads passing by this property. The staff was very helpful and the next time going to Lauderdale we would stay there again, no doubt.....

title: Courtyard Ft. Lauderdale East
review: I've been staying at this property for several years. I really like this property, so I keep coming back because of clean rooms, nice pool, good breakfast, helpful staff.   My only negative this trip was that no one made up the room on my last night there, even after a call to housekeeping. Housekeeping promised to make up the room and never did, and I had to call for towels a second time.

title: New Years in Lauderdale
review: Parking is easy, plentiful and free.    Check in was fast and the associate welcomed us and remembered us from a previous stay,  (Typical high caliber Marriott associate).  Room was CLEAN and spacious.  Great water pressure, comfortable bed and good A/C.  This property was not built as a Courtyard.  This is great for the following: ALL rooms have balcony. All rooms have a bose radio. All rooms have a refrigerator. Pool is nicer then “stock” Courtyards. Exercise room is nice and you will almost always have it to yourself. The front desk and guest rooms are two separate buildings.  They are connected by a short, covered walkway.  This may be a problem in cold climates but rarely in S Florida.  The accommodation’s building is always locked and you must have a room key to enter. …

title: Good location, average hotel
review: The hotel was a short way from beach (walkable) and as on two major roads it was easy to get around. They still have the Courtyard Cafe, but that is being replaced in April with the new Courtyard Bistro ("Starbucks-like") which is a shame. However, there is a Denny's across the street for full service breakfast. Maid service was slow and inconsistent; 4 of 9 days I had to ask for things which should have been handled by the maids. One day the maids forgot to clean my room all together. The only major complaint would be that this hotel can be noisy. I could hear people in the room above me walking around and had to complain twice about the noise from the room next to mine. All things being equal, I would probably stay here again.

title: Good location, average hotel..
review: The hotel was an average hotel, good friendly staff who sorted out requests at the earliest. Its a short drive from the beach!! The rooms were clean and well maintained. We will not be staying again there … but a decent place..

title: Wonderful stay in Fort Lauderale
review: We spent a few days in Fort Lauderdale and were lucky enough to find this gem. Great front desk staff, incredibly comfortable beds, quiet rooms - A shuttle available to take us shopping as well as to the beach area for dinner, etcetera.  Shuttle drivers very helpful and friendly.  The breakfast was incredible - home made waffles, made to order omelets, etcetera.  The fellow in the breakfast room is a delight - lots of great stories of his trips around the world working for a cruise line. We would certainly stay here again and highly recommend it.

title: Great location, friendly staff
review: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, my room was clean and quiet, and the location was perfect for a business traveler. Close to restaurants, shopping, and the interstate. It's also a short drive to the beach for a little relaxation! Highly recommend, great value.

title: Great Visit but sometimes I'm confused
review: My wife and I had a Great visit last week but I'm somewhat confused regarding whether we should be receiving your wonderfu buffet breakfast as part of our stay.  During all of our previous stays we received the Buffet Breakfast "free of charge" as part of the room rate.  But this time we did not.  I reserved the room "on-line" and I'm a Marriott Rewards Card Member so I guess that I'm just a little confused.  Were we simply lucky on the previous occasions?  Or has your Policy changed?  Otherwise, the room and our stay was very nice.  Thank-you,  Stephen Holmes

title: Friendly Staff
review: From the front desk to the restaurant, I received genuine happy greetings, smiling faces and helpful service. The layout of the hotel is a little different: room was at an adjoining building connected by a covered walk way. My room overlooked a decent sized pool. Ample parking. Breakfast had a nice array of cold and hot sidhes and an omlette station. This was the least expensive of the Courtyards in the Ft. Lauderdale beach area. I took a cab from the hotel to the beach area at Sunrise Blvd to meet some friends; cost was $20. Workout room had 2 up-to-date treadmills, an elliptical and bike along with dumbbells. Mattress was firm and comfortable.

title: Courtyard
review: I felt that the Marriott was really just average, especially for the money.  I spent the night there prior to surgery at a nearby hospital and I was given a quiet room which was most important but I didn't feel there were tremendous amenities.  The in-room safe did not work.  They did have coffee in rooms and downstairs in lobby and some cookies at desk.

title: Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East
review: My room was dirty, my sheets had stains on them... I let the front desk know and all she said i will lwt house keeping know you where not happy... i am all set with this hotel

title: WELL RUN WITH EMPLOYEES WHO REALLY CARE YOUR STAY THERE
review: Dear Kimberly W,  My goodness! I am so sorry!  With a response like that after experiencing such issues, I would be all set with the hotel as well. Please accept my most sincere apologies.  Thank you for sharing your experience. I have discussed it with our staff and reiterated the importance of providing a perfectly clean room each and every time, and that such responses when we fail to do so are absolutely unacceptable.  I do hope that you give us another chance to live up to our reputation of wonderful accommodations and friendly staff.  Sincerely,  Rob Lewis General Manager

title: Clean units and friendly staff
review: This courtyard by Marriott is very well run, maintained, professional, clean, etc.  I would highly recommend it to anyone.

title: Convenient but average hotel
review: This is our third stay at this hotel to be close by to family.  Hotel staff is very nice and accommodating.  We did not pay for breakfast so can not comment on that.  There was a problem with our toilet and it ran and squeaked all night long.  We didn't have time to mention it to the staff because our stay was only 2 nights, but I'm sure they would have tried to do something about it if we had.  Bed's are average as far as comfort.  Clean room.  Liked having two sinks, one in bathroom and one outside bathroom.  TV's are old tube style - kind of surprising.

title: Best value in East Fort Lauderdale
review: We have stayed here numerous times and the hotel is consistently clean, quiet and affordable!

title: stay review
review: good location & amenities, restaurants & stores are near

title: Good hotel...staff not responsive
review: Stayed for trip to conference...  Average room condition compare to brand Marriott. The front desk staff had put some hold charge on my travelcard. The same never returned on bill settlement.   Repeated phone call, email followup and no response. Don't care who you are after check out.

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Jrd123,  Thank you for taking the time to post your comment. I sincerely apologize if there was a discrepancy on your statement. We would, of course, address the issue immediately when brought to our attention. I am very sorry we had a communication failure and would like to resolve this matter at once. I invite you to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com and I will personally ensure a correct settlement.  We truly value our guests and do everything we can to make them feel welcomed and ensure their satisfaction before, during and after their stay.  Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: The staff made this hotel!!
review: My family and I were in town a couple weeks ago for the local boat show. The staff was very helpful and genuinely cared about how our stay was going. The lady at the front desk from newfoundland and christine were superb.They had great recommendations for dinner (a nice casual place right on the beach with live music) and places to go for the kids. This hotel is located a bit farther away from the action than I wanted. If your not renting a car while in the area , I'd pick a different hotel. When we filled up the bath tub the water was a bit yellow and  front desk said "That's how the water is in Florida," which I seriously doubt. Upon checkout I had some problems with my billl. They over charge me for breakfast and I had a couple movie charges which i did not order. Christine…

title: The staff were superb
review: I presented a seminar this last weekend. The staff were exceptionally nice and went out of their way to see my needs were met. The meeting room and sleeping room were in excelent condition. Will definitely use their facilities again.

title: Good Location
review: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times, Great Location, great bang for the buck.  However, , although they have new beds, they changed the laundry.  Sheets were rough and sandpaper like, really did not enjoy thins change.  If they go back to the soft and comfortable sheets it is definitely the place to sta if Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Decent Courtyard - great price and wonderful breakfast service
review: Stayed here earlier this week for two nights.  Hotel has started to modernize rooms and I had one of them.  Very nice.  Beds were new 2 months ago.  Pillows nice.  Breakfast in morning is very good with an omelet/egg bar for eggs any way you want them.  Front desk was friendly.  Good value for the business traveler for sure.  I paid half of what others were paying at discounted rates at the W.

title: Good hotel with great service.
review: My wife and I stayed at the hotel during the Ft Lauderdale boat show.  It was about 6 miles away from the show but well worth the travel for the good price and great service.  Our room was clean and fresh,  the breakfast we had at the hotel was very good and the diner we had at the Sea Watch restaurant (just a few miles away on the ocean) was GREAT.  we would recommend both to anyone traveling to Ft Lauderdale.

title: Served its purpose
review: This hotel was definitely dated.  There wasn't a hair dryer in the room and there was a pair of panties (not ours) hanging underneath the sink...though, overall it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was a good size, although we weren't in there much.  Probably the best option in the area, but still a bit overpriced for what it is.

title: Comfortable Rooms and Beds, Not Far From the Beach
review: I have always been very happy with my stays at Courtyard hotels.  The rooms and beds (in particular) have always been excellent and I have always been able to sleep well, which is the main thing I want from a hotel.  The staff members, for the most part, have always been courteous, engaging, and informative.   I would like to make one suggestion for Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East:  I did not have a car during my stay and asked the desk clerk how I might get downtown, and she informed me that the only way would be by taxi.  However, a couple days later a different clerk told me that the Number 10 bus, for which there is a stop right at the corner, goes downtown, and that there is also a water taxi that services a number or areas.  I think I really would have enjoyed the water…

title: Mixed Feelings
review: I rated this hotel as average ONLY because of the bed, it was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept on. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the breakfast buffet was good.

title: Great pool. Convenient location.
review: Dated but very well maintained.  Excellent pool area.  Abundant free parking. Need a bar on site.

title: Pretty Average, but nice
review: Pros: 1) close to 95 2) Nice Pool 3) Clean rooms 4) Close to food and shops and beach  Cons: 1) When I booked online I asked for additional towels and early check in (at 2pm). Since we drove 4 hours to get to Ft. Lauderdale we wanted to be able to check in when we got there. When we arrived they stated that our room wasnt read and to come back at 3:00pm.  I called at 3:30pm to see if it was ready and they still said "No". So that was a little frustrating.  2) Concerige Luggage Carts: were IMPOSSIBLE to find. I had to ask a cleaner for one, which he had stashed in the housekeeping closet. He was very nice and helpful, but if he wasnt there I would have been in trouble. The next morning on checkout there were NONE to be found. I searched every floor and none. So it took me two…

title: very nice hotel
review: We loved this hotel, after moving out of a much more run down hotel on the beach.  Perfect for our day of just swimming in the pool-even throughout the entire day of rain.  very very comfortable beds and nice sized room.   very nice staff.  they have a nice bfast in the morning for a fee, and Dennys right across the street.  pretty busy intersection, and a few eating places within walking distance.  the scenery is not all that great in the area.

title: MOST UNCOMFORTABLE BED
review: The staff was friendly, and the buffet was great and reasonably priced, but we literally had the worst night sleep.  The beds springs were poking up.  Also, any time one of us moved it shook the whole bed.  The floor did not feel clean under my feet, either.

title: Average stay
review: Enjoyed our stay here....I wouldn't say it overwhelmed us, but it met our expectations.  If you've stayed at one CbM, you've stayed at this one.    Location was good, restaurants are located close by  for convenience.  We booked online, and saved doing so.

title: Very Nice Courtyard!!!!
review: Great Location, close to all shopping, restaurants, the beautiful beach...safe clean adn secure...nice pool and hot tub. And being a Rewards Member I received Breakfast daily so that was a special added treat.

title: Property's Interior Use to Be Better
review: The first time I stayed in this hotel was in early 2010 and I have been a returning customer ever since but I don't know if I will return.  I was disappointed with the interior of the hotel especially the hallways and the room. Both the hallways and the room had a less than pleasant smell . The room appeared to be clean but it did not smell fresh and clean like I am accustomed too. The bathroom was not clean, the towels were stained. The bedding was also stained. If my stay in the area was more than one night I think I would have checked out and gone to another hotel

title: Nice place to stay
review: A confortable room, well cleaned and organized.  Wireless internet works ok also. The hotel location is excellent, betwwen US1 and i95, near the shore aswell. The hotel is nice, unfortunately, no complementary breakfest option. You must consider an extra $10,00 + tip/taxes daily.

title: Comforting
review: This was a very comfortable hotel, felt safe and it was quiet. The hospitality was awesome!!

title: Good for a short stay
review: I only needed accomodations for 2 nights and did not need the amenities of a 4 or 5 star hotel; and the Courtyard fit that bill at a reasonable price.  The staff were friendly and helpful; the room was clean and comfortable; and the buffet breakfast was excellent.  I would stay at the Courtyard again if the opportunity arose.

title: Great location in fort lauderdale
review: the hotel is in a great location, nice conection with the us 1 and the i 95, rooms are fine and clean, front desk was friendly. Breakfast is good, maybe the only complain is that there is no people to help you out with the luggage.

title: Good start for vacations
review: Friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, nice pool, excellent breakfast

title: I Felt more at home than being in my own home!
review: The Courtyard Marriott was my girlfriends choice for her wedding guests. I have stayed at the Marriott before in Virginia and other places so I didn't object. I have to say that your staff was extremly friendly upon check in. The room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. What made our stay extraoridinary was your breakfast cafe staff! They welcomed us, and attended to our every need. The chef Marnus seemed gueninely happy to see us daily. I can say enjoy about your hotel and we are already thinking about planning to come back. Eveyone raves about Miami but Fort Lauderdale is apparently where the true hospitality is! Thank you and we will be back, and next time we will bring our children!  Thanks Again,   The Mobleys

title: Great Accomodations and Location
review: We wanted a reasonably priced location central to the Fort Lauderdale area.  The Courtyard fit that bill perfectly.

title: Our Getway
review: On our recent trip to Florida for the holiday weekend, our stay at the Courtyard was very nice. We reserved a King but was told it was overbooked they had to give us a Queen...to make up for it we were given two days of complimentary breakfast. The breakfast was awesome and a great addition to our stay.   Thank you for your Kindness and hospitality Courtyard.  We definitely will be returning.

title: Friendly Staff, Poor accomodations
review: the issue i have with this Marriott facility is the carpets in the room that I stayed in was absolutely filthy!!  I walk around with white socks because of medical challenges (diabetes) and the bottom of my socks were, let me put it this way,  "I'm throwing those socks away!"   Made mention of this to administrative assistant and out came the not apologies but out poured the excuses!!  All same response when I mentioned the tiny bugs which I found crawling around. The response that all hotels and resorts are having a problem at this time of the year is not something a paying customer wants to hear.  obviously she was aware of the problem -- FIX IT!!

title: Great hotel stay
review: Dear Crunchy80237,  Please accept my most sincere apologies for your unpleasant experience at our hotel.  I can understand your frustration and appreciate your valuable feedback.  We have taken action to correct these issues.  We hope that our friendly staff will make you feel welcome again during future visits to Fort Lauderdale.  Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis General Manager

title: We will not stay here again
review: Unfortunately, this place was not as clean as we would have liked. For instance, the linen had a stain on them, which I am hoping was a stain as opposed to a lack of washing. The following morning after our first night stay, I woke up itching, which was problematic.  Also, the walls were paper thin, so we were able to hear all of the rowd and noisy neighbors. As such, we weren't able to get much sleep.  Lastly, I was displeased with the price of the breakfast as many Courtyards provide such complimentary. This is something this property should consider given the fact that guests have to actually exit their buidling to go over to the main building. If I am going to exit my buidling, I will exit to pay for another breakfast at a better location. This is something management should…

title: Great hotel. Price vs Benefits
review: Dear Suntrease W,  Thank you for posting your review. We are glad that, by choosing the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East, you enjoyed our complimentary coffee available in the lobby and were centrally located to your place of business. I truly apologize for the inconvenience with the linens. It is our requirement to dispose of any bedding that is not in perfect condition and we have reiterated this with our Housekeeping staff.   I am very sorry you were not able to have the restful and relaxing sleep we desire for all our guests. The walls in between rooms are solid block or poured concrete, not only dry wall as many other hotels, so they must have been some noisy neighbors! I wish you would have notified the front desk, and we would have addressed the situation.   We are one of the few Courtyards that still offer a full breakfast buffet featuring cooked-to-order omelets, top of the line bacon, biscuits and gravy, home style potatoes, grits, assorted fruit fresh cut daily, hot oatmeal with accompaniments, various yogurt, muffins, bagels and more, for only $9.95.The other Courtyards in the area that offer a buffet, yet not Award Winning as is ours, are priced the same or higher.  I am sorry you did not find this offering a value added amenity as do the majority of our guests and local area neighbors.   As you mentioned, our hotel is comprised of two adjacent buildings integrated by a tropically landscaped walkway. One structure hosts the rooms and the other the main lobby, café and meeting room. I am disappointed our hotel layout was not to your satisfaction.   Thank you choosing us during your stay in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.   Best regards,   Rob Lewis General Manager

title: We found a new home away from home
review: I'm glad to say that this is a great hotel. Its location is great, everything is near including the beach.  I recommend this hotel!

title: Great Courtyard
review: Breakfast fit for a king, none like it at all other chain hotels. Staff were all 100% attentive to our needs and pleasant to work with. Hotel facilities from the lobby, to the room, to the breakfast area to the pool were immaculately clean.

title: Everyone was welcoming and helpful.
review: Needed a quick last minute hotel and Trip Advisor did not let me down! Great location and really nice rooms - the only bad thing I can say is that the maids were banging on our door at 11h45 (even though we had a do not distrurb sign out).  We were scurrying to get out of there before 12h00 and this just slowed us down.  No big deal really.....liked this hotel and would gladly stay there again.

title: We felt so welcomed and so cared for.
review: The trip and the stay was centered around the reception for our mother's memorial service.  We had extended family staying at the hotel and we had a mid-day reception held in a reception room.  The staff could not have been better!  They were responsive and wonderful and so, so flexible to all our needs.  The food was excellent and the rates of the room were a wonderful value.  I can't express any more accolades other than to say that I have rarely been so impressed by any hospitality facility.  The fact that it was provided during a time when we were all so consumed with our loss made it that much more impressive.   Thank you, thank you, thank you.

title: Adequate and comfortable
review: We stayed at this hotel while my wife was having surgery at the nearby Holy Cross hospital. The room was fine. The bed was comfortable and give me internet access and TV and I am happy. Free parking was refreshing after paying $25 per night on the beach for parking. The only issue I had was ants, which my sister in the next room and my daughter down the hall did not have. I complained every day and the management was very responsive, They sent someone to spray daily and some days twice but the ants kept coming. The breakfasts were OK, the price was reasonable for the area. The gentleman who cooked the eggs somehow found about my wife being in the hospital and asked about her every day, which was very nice. I would stay at this hotel again, but would avoid room 201.

title: Infested with bugs
review: In a previous trip to Ft. Lauderdale, I stayed at the Courtyard near the executive airport.  However, it was noisy, so this time I decided to try another location.  When I first arrived, I thought the property looked nice and well laid out, and my room was comfortable.  However, after I went into the bathroom in my room, I noticed a lot of dead bugs on the floor.  They looked like little winged ants or large gnats.  I thought they had probably recently sprayed as I didn't see any live bugs, so I didn't worry about it too much.  I did not spend a lot of time in my room - pretty much there just to shower and sleep.  The next morning I noticed a lot of live bugs and tried to kill them.  I moved all my belongings away from the bathroom area since that seemed to be where they stayed…

title: This Marriott is like finding an oasis!
review: Dear s_fuzzy,  Oh my goodness! I can completely understand the feeling of aversion bybeing in a room with pests. Thank you for trusting us with your accommodations in Fort Lauderdale and we blew it! I am truly sorry about your experience!  Orkin, our professional pest control company, informed us, that just as you mentioned, these are “winged ants” and are harmless, but still unsettling. The recent heavy rains disrupt their environments and “gets them on the move”, finding any sources of light available. Any open doors or windows provide an opportunity for them to enter buildings, which, in this case, unfortunately affected the rooms you were accommodated in. We were assured that these pests live outside, and NOT in sewers and drains as previously guessed.   Orkin has treated the surrounding outside area as well as the few affected rooms. During our daily inspections, my housekeeping staff and I are on the look out for any signs of these unwelcomed guests to immediately remedy the situation and maintain a welcoming environment.   I really hope that our friendly service, convenient location and dedicated staff will encourage you to consider giving us another chance during any future stays in Fort Lauderdale. I invite you to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com and I will ensure you receive the high quality standards the Courtyard by Marriott Fort Lauderdale East is known for.    Sincerely,  Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: A pleasant surprise
review: In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Route 1 and Commercial Blvd. in Ft. Lauderdale you'll find the calm and tranquel Courtyard East.  The staff is friendly and helpful, the property is clean and very well located, the amenities are perfect, but my favorite is the pool - like finding and oasis!  Perfect for families, couples, pre-cruise or any occasion.

title: Bugs in the room
review: I had bugs in my room, mgt slow to react.  Told them first thing in the morning and no one followed up until I reached out to Marriott 2 days later.  Plenty of choices of other hotels in FTL if they are going to be slow to respond.

title: You guys are great
review: Dear Emsinvestor,  Thank you for your loyalty to Marriott! It is because of your continued support that Marriott has become as successful as we are today. Your comments are truly valued, especially as a Marriott Rewards Elite Member. I am terribly sorry we failed to meet the high quality of standards we have accustomed our guests to and sincerely apologize for your inconvenience during your stay.    Thank you for notifying us about your experience upon your departure that morning. Our Chief Engineer was promptly sent to your room to address the situation. We are aware of the issue that was unfortunately experienced last week, and are pleased to say it is completely under control.   I am truly sorry we were unaware of your desire to be contacted immediately upon your departure. However, I trust that our instant response to your e-mail with our further apologies and concessions was to your satisfaction.   We again thank you for choosing Marriott as your preferred brand during your travels and hope you will consider us during future trips to Fort Lauderdale.  We look forward to having the pleasure of accommodating you in the near future.   Sincerely,  Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: Never saw so many pleasant people!
review: As an almost weekly guest at the hotel, it has become like a second home. Everyone who works there is warm and friendly. It's nice to get recognized by name when I walk into the lobby and I always enjoy a more than coridal exchange with employees. I look forward to connecting with the serving staff at breakfast and appreciate learning and sharing with them. The warmth of the staff and their consistent consideration makes the hotel a very pleasant place to stay. A warm "thank you" to everyone there.

title: When I have business in Ft. Lauderdale, I will stay here.
review: I have stayed at this property multiple times. The physical plant is older, but very well maintained. But the staff is absolutely terrific! Everyone smiles, acknowledges all guests, strike up conversations when appropriate, and generally can convert a lousy day with a client into a very pleasant evening. Well located in NE Ft. lauderdale. Breakfast omlets are outstanding. Wish the teapots for hot waterr were larger to give more water at one time, but this is really splitting hairs! Stay here if you want a pleasant surprise and a happy experience! Ask for rooms in the floors ending in 01, 03, 05 or 07 to ov erlook the pool and not the parking lot. (PS----I am writing this from room 303, and will be here again for 3-4 days)

title: Very disappointed... and concerned
review: Service was excellent, EVERYONE was curteous and friendly.  The breakfast was fresh and my omelet was cooked to perfection.  Check-out was easy and fast.

title: Nice and Clean
review: Stayed only one night, but it was quiet, clean, and pleasant.  The restaurant had good food (recommend buffet if you are hungry!).  Close enough to walk to the beach.  Will use this hotel the next time we visit Florida.

title: Does not live up to name
review: I have stayed in several Marriott hotels, and unfortunately this one in particular does not live up to the name.   The first thing I noticed was ants in the room. They are the tiny ones, so it didn't think too much of them.  After four days at the hotel, they finally called after breakfast was over and said "oh, by the way, your rate includes breakfast." That would've been nice information a little earlier.   We went to Red Lobster down the street, and I got my dessert to go. I was really looking forward to eating the brownie, but when I went to get it out of the fridge, the ants had gone to town on it. I really wanted something sweet to eat so I went to the sundry shop and got some Hagen Daaz (sp?) ice cream. I paid $6.50 for it, and when I got back to my room, it was obvious…

title: CONSISTENTLY TOP NOTCH
review: Dear Lizzie,  Thank you for sharing your experience.  Your comments allow us to pinpoint the areas that we must continue to improve on. I sincerely apologize for not being able to deliver the high standards of quality and service Courtyard by Marriott is known for.   I can imagine how uneasy you felt by finding ants in your room. I am so sorry! Our housekeeping staff closely inspects all guest rooms and are on the lookout for any kind of unwelcomed pests that may try to filter in from the outside. Our pest control company has been called in for an inspection as well.   We did have a malfunction of our freezer in The Market, and I regret that you experienced the consequences. This issue has now been resolved and the Haagen Daz ice cream replaced.  The hot tub is in working order; however our Chief Engineer will continue to monitor it closely for any temperature fluctuations.   I am surprised with your impressions of the front office staff, since they are usually highly praised. However, I have reiterated the importance of attending the guests immediately and always being visible and available.  Thank you for your kind words about our Chef and Rodney. I have passed along your comments to them.   We are glad that you were able to take full advantage of our complimentary local transportation and make your fiancé's birthday a very special one. I invite you to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com or 954-771-8100 x 601 to discuss the details of your experience and show our appreciation for your business and loyalty to Marriott.   Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis General Manager

title: As always, a highlight in our Florida Road trip!
review: This is not first time staying here, have stayed here many times over the past several years. Stay here for business and pleasure.  Location perfect.  We were here for 2 days.  Everything was excellent, from Elaine making sure we got connecting rooms, to check in with Christine and front staff being very helpful.  The housekeeping staff very friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast staff were very helpful and friendly including the cooks who made perfect special order eggs...The pool area excellent and all in all everything was terrific.  Marriott beds are always the best, and main reason we stay Marriott as well as the points..... Only caveat for travelers here......do not stay on first floor in rooms close to the elevator as the tile floor and rollons making a terrible…

title: NICE LOCATION
review: I have been staying at this hotel since 1996!  I have never been disappointed.  I started as a busness traveler and then choose the hotel for my leisure travels as a single girl...great location, great price, great service (although I very much miss Topanga Grill!!!).  Today...married mother of four and when we visit friends and family in Lauderdale...we stay her for all of the previously mentioned reasons.  Pool is easy to manage with the kids...never too crowded.  Rooms are always clean and the staff is consistent and they always rememeber us.  Special shout-outs to Elaine & Anna at the front desk and Angie in the cafe.   The hotel is located on a busy intersection, but it doesn't ever bother us...we know if we wanted beach front, that's where we'd stay (beach is less than a…

title: Great location in Ft. Lauderdale!
review: Centrally located away from the beach on Federal Highway in Ft. Lauderdale. Older hotel but VERY clean and comfortable. Quiet, too!

title: Great Place
review: I have stayed at this hotel many times.  It is clean, safe, friendly and well located.  Unless you really need a place right on the beach in Fort Lauderdale, this is the place to stay.  1 mile from the beach, located on Federal highway, it is convenient to everywhere.  Location, price, amenities... it has it all

title: First experience of Courtyard - maybe the last
review: bed was more uncomfortable than sleeping on the floor, which I seriously considered. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel sizes were so mean that I ran out in the middle of the shower, had to get front desk to send some more and then continue. Not enough towels. Hallways looked like a college dorm, not pictures on walls, just dull mustard colored paint. Rooms a mishmash of styles and colors, non of which seemed to go together. No pool towels at pool, you had to collect from reception, but no notice to say that you had to (other guests had same problem) Hotel seems to specialize in guests who can only slam doors between 5am - 7am rather than close them, certainly no need for an alarm call because you won't be asleep (unless you want to get up before 5am). No newspapers - even though…

title: Felt like home away from home.
review: Dear Sue45551, I sincerely thank you for sharing you experience at our hotel and am truly sorry that you were not satisfied during your stay. I can understand your frustration when not having a good night’s sleep in the mattress type of your choice.  In an effort to provide our guests with a better sleeping experience, we are in the process of upgrading our bedding to soft, plush, pillow top mattresses, which are certain to better suit our customer’s preferences.  Our bathroom amenities are intended for a two to three time use and our standard rooms are prepared with three bath towels, two hand towels, and two washcloths. Of course, it is our pleasure to provide more as requested.  The hotel’s décor was specified and approved by the Marriott Corporate Design team. I am sorry to learn that it is not your liking.  We have had our pool towels available at the Front Desk for many years, and to our knowledge, it had never posed an issue. I really appreciate you bringing this to our attention and we will certainly consider adding a sign that provides more direction to our guests.  I apologize for any disruptions in the morning. Our rooms are equipped with door closures that prevent these from slamming. However, when additional force is used, it may create some sound.  We provide both the Wall Street Journal and USA Today newspapers, Monday thru Fridays, except on Holidays. These are available at the Front Desk on a first come, first serve basis. We normally order more than is usually consumed to ensure that our guests are pleased. I am deeply sorry if that day was the rare one we had much more demand than expected.    With the increase in internet usage and the size of downloads, our maximum band width is reached in peak times. We are in the process of updating our complimentary high speed internet access to provide faster services to our guests. I truly am sorry for any inconveniences these may have caused.  Thank you for your compliments on our staff. We do pride on our team and it is always a joy to learn that our guests are receiving the excellent service we strive to provide.  If there is anything I can do to improve your perception of our hotel, I invite you to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com.   Kindest regards, Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: Correct for one night
review: I was in town visiting my mother while she was at Holy Cross Hospital. It's within walking distance to the hospital, so the location was a wise choice. My stay was extended three times due to medical complications and the folks at the front desk were courteous, gracious and genuinely caring about my situation. The grounds are pristine, the rooms are clean as a whistle, and every employee you deal with is friendly and professional. I would highly recommend this location to anyone visiting Fort Lauderdale. I stayed for two weeks and was sad to go. The folks at the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East made a tough personal situation for me a lot easier with their hospitality.

title: Everything About This Hotel is Fantastic!
review: We recently held a meeting at this hotel and everything was fabulous!   The staff is incredible...all very helpful and friendly.  The sales person we worked with was top notch.  She addressed our every need.  The hotel itself is immaculate from the lobby to the rooms to the pool....all of it.

title: No special requests, please.
review: Had a tough time sleeping due to noisy wedding parties that celebrated loudly on their patio below us until around 3:00am. Due to a special dietary requirement, I requested a boiled egg for breakfast and was bluntly told by the chef that it couldn't be done in any way shape or form.

title: Outstanding service
review: We arrived very late due to flight delays but the night desk attendee was extremely friendly and quickly took care of our check in. The hotel is a bit dated but the friendly service and comfortable bed makes up for this.  The breakfast was offered at an additional fee but we opted not to chance it, as we prefer not to pay for hotel food, as this can sometimes be disappointing. We decided to use the Denny’s conveniently located across the street & had a great meal.  Overall, the hotel was perfect for what we expected. We used it for a quick stay until we could check into our beach hotel the next day. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful when we need to ship a lost cell phone back to us. Four stars for the customer service & a very comfortable bed.

title: Good hotel for business travel
review: Dear rudylottie,  Thank you for your wonderful review of the Courtyard by Marriott Fort Lauderdale East! Your loyalty and recommendations are truly appreciated. We are thrilled that you are able to enjoy the hotel and the area attractions while in Fort Lauderdale.   We are looking forward to having the pleasure of accommodating you again in the near future!   Kindest regards,  Rob Lewis

title: A nice stay before the cruise.
review: Nice place, friendly staff, good fitness area, convenient to most things in the area. I have stayed here for years and I know what I will get when I arrive. i recommend this place to colleagues all the time.

title: Comfortable
review: We had a very nice stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Ft. Lauderdale Ease before and after our cruise.  The room was large, very clean, comfortable beds, nice balcony and business center.  Did not eat at the buffet on Sat-Sun but it sure looked good at a reasonable price.  Would definitely stay there again and at other Courtyard Marriotts

title: Nice hotel but dont let the bed bugs bite!
review: Beautiful hotel in a good location albeit near a noisy intersection.  Huge pool and nice hot tub.  The room is of contemporary design and spacious with a small bar and workstation.  Plenty of restaurants nearby.  The only negative, and its a big negative, is bed bugs!  I stayed there 5 days and began noticing small red welts all over my body.  At first it was just a few but then grew in number each day.  Only after returning home and researching it did I discover the cause.  If it werent for the bugs, it would have been a great stay.

title: Refurbished hotel with smaller rooms and friendly staff
