review: Thank you for your Tripadvisor post. We take pride in providing great service and outstanding accommodations to all of our guests, I apologize that your experience was less than perfect. Reports about bed bugs are on the rise for hotels, transportation providers, movie theaters, and retail stores throughout the world - it is important for proactive consumers, like yourself, to report any suspected occurrences as soon as possible so that appropriate procedures can be implemented. As a precaution, I placed your room off market as well as the adjoining rooms and the rooms above and below and have had our pest control company, PIP, professionally treat those rooms. Additionally, we inspected all the rooms in the hotel to ensure that they are completely clean and ready for our guests. I would genuinely appreciate the opportunity to speak with you regarding your experience and invite you to contact me by e-mail or telephone at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com or 954-771-8100.  Sincerely, Rob Lewis General Manager

title: Marriott Courtyard employees make a difference
review: Watch out if you book a Queen size bed that it isn't just a full-size in disguise.

title: Emily provided excellent customer service! I will stay with you again.
review: Great Location.  Not far from mall and really good restaurants. Room was clean and lots of space.  Balcony is a nice bonus. Swimming pool clean and water warm

title: Work and Play
review: We enjoyed our stay at your hotel. We found all staff from the cleaning and care taking, to kitchen and front desk to be helpful, professional and friendly. We would have not reservation recommending your hotel to friends and colleges going to the Fort Lauderdale area.

title: Ok place to stay, overpriced for the location on a busy street.
review: Older property and even though I was "paying" thru my points, I did not feel the property was worth the price.  Location on a busy street with sirens constantly.  Loud guests in the pool and jacuzzi made it unpleasant and uncomfortable to enjoy the pool and jacuzzi.  Towels in the room were thin.   Nice to have free Wi-fi which was expected with the price per night. Great breakfast buffet.

title: Comfortable and clean in sunny Ft Lauderdale
review: Dear Tralrunr18, Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us. We sincerely regret you were not able to have the experience you desired in our pool area. The hotel is conveniently located on Federal Highway and Commercial Boulevard, which allows for easy access and proximity to the restaurants, shopping and Fort Lauderdale Beach. Because of this we do have occasional emergency vehicles pass by. During your time at the pool there must have been a major incident which required a large amount of emergency response. I can understand how uncomfortable this could be, and I apologize. The rooms, however, are equipped with heavy duty commercial grade sliding glass doors which mute outside sound substantially.  I am sorry that our towels were not to your liking. We abide by Courtyard brand standards and will certainly share your comments with the Marriott team when the opportunity arises.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our cooked to order breakfast buffet and our complimentary wireless internet throughout the property.     Kindest regards, Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: Very accommodating
review: This hotel and its staff are fantastic.  The rooms are clean and updated.  The location is perfect to the beach and surronding restaurants and activities.  The breakfast is delicious and the snack bar is plentiful.  The pool and ammenities are well maintained and easy to use.  Thanks for a wonderful vacation in the sunshine!

title: Warm greetings throughout the hotel
review: My wife and I spent a week at the Courtyard and had a pleasant stay.  As with most places there is good and bad.  The good was the staff, great breakfast (9.99 if not included with your price but still worth it), the rooms were neat and well kept with 2 sinks (one in the bath area and one just outside the bath), the pool/hottub was very nice  and a small fitness center that accommodated some cardio and a few hand weights.  The bad is the location.  The hotel/motel is located on a busy intersection with frequent emergency vehicles passing at all hours with loud sirens.  The only other issue we had was we could hear the people above us walking around during the evening and early mornings.  If we were to stay there again I would request a top floor room and if the room was on the…

title: Great hotel and staff!
review: The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful.  They made us feel at home.  The accomidations were great with no problems.  Thanks for a nice stay.

title: BEST place to stay in the Fort Lauderdale area!!!!
review: This hotel is exactly what you need when visiting family in the Fort Lauderdale area. They try to fullfill all of your request...like particular rooms and early check in. The front desk staff is great and their Director of Sales and Marketing is a very warm personable person that will help you in any way possible. Weekends they generally offer free breakfast if you have a Marriott Reward account. If not breakfast is $8.95 for cold items and $9.95 with cooked to order omlette's and eggs. They have waffles, bacon,sausage (sometimes corn beef hash) potatoes, grits and sausage gray.They have THE BEST BREAKFAST I have ever had at a hotel and we travel alot. I always look forward to their cooked to order omlette. Very personable staff and cook in their restaurant. They only serve…

title: Pleasant experience
review: All was good with my stay, staff pleasant, rooms very nice.  Only one complaint, I booked a king room and upon arrival was told that I was changed to a queen .  no choice...however, hotel and stay very pleasant.  Thank You...

title: GREAT stay!
review: Had a wonderful one week stay.  Really enjoyed hanging out in the pool and whirlpool under beautiful skies while the rest of the country was buried under snow.  Room was super comfortable and relatively quiet.  You can hear people talking in the hallway but not even a small problem.  Other pluses are the location, free fresh fruit in the lobby, friendly staff, great fitness room and THE POOL.  Had a GREAT stay and can't wait to take my Winter blues break there again.

title: Wonderful Lauderdale by the Sea Hotel!
review: Greetings Retinr,   We are very happy to hear that you had a great stay with us and that you were able to enjoy our wonderful Florida weather.  Thank you for your warm comments and for choosing to stay at the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East. We are looking forward to seeing you again during your next “winter blues break”.    Warm and sunny wishes  Rob Lewis  General Manager

title: Perfect accomodations and staff
review: This hotel is clean, quiet and absolutely comfortable.  My aunt was in the hospital across the street from the hotel so it was so convenient for me in terms of location.  The staff is absolutely wonderful, friendly and concerned.

title: Fit our needs well.
review: Staff was very helpful and very friendly.  Pool area was nice.  Complimentary breakfast with our package was very nice and helpful.

title: Friendly responsive staff in delightful environment
review: Wonderful reception from courteous and enthusiastic staff.  Everyone went out of their way to help and make us feel welcome. Rooms were clean and well thought out in design.  Will definitely stay here again when in Fort Lauderdale.

title: Great place to stay
review: Loved everything about this hotel, nothing negative to say.

title: A Wedding Stay
review: Room was comfortable, new beds I was told.  These were comfortable.  Had a problem with toilet flapper not seating properly.  I mentioned this to the maintenance man who fixed this immediately.  Would like to see a microwave in the room but space is a precious commodity and do not have a recommendation of where to put it.    Would like to have sat on the balcony to enjoy the fresh air and view but there were no chairs or table like on the first floor.  Is this a possible future addition?

title: A tired old place that needs to be put out of its misery
review: Slowest Internet service I've experienced in almost 10 years...when I called the front desk, was told "there have been other complaints but we can't do anything about it". Whe I called iBahn, I was told "everything is okay". (By the way, the two folks I was travelling with each had to give up on working from their room for the reason). Even the office center was slow response Coffee machine in room wasn't working..... Food quality at buffet was mediocre at best Front desk personell on Sunday nighyt, January 30 were professional and courteous; after that, it was all downhill

title: Gracious flexibility
review: Dear Castoff1  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us about your recent stay. It is with comments like yours that we are able to better accommodate our guest needs.  I can understand how frustrating it was for you to experience a slow connection to the internet and sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. We have contacted our Internet provider iBAHN, who found that we had high guest connectivity and we were reaching our limits of bandwidth. We have worked with our provider and have significantly increased our bandwidth, allowing our guests to have the high-speed internet connection that is expected.    Again, I am sorry for the coffee machine in the room not working and that you were not satisfied with our cooked-to-order breakfast buffet. I am certainly surprised, since we normally get high compliments on the food quality and service.  Thank you for your pointers on our front desk personnel. We are constantly working hard at training and will continue to do so.  If you are ever in the Fort Lauderdale area again, I would sincerely hope you would give us another chance. Please contact me directly and I will personally take care of the arrangements, ensuring that all is to your satisfaction.   Kindest regards, Rob Lewis

title: I felt like I got the old "bait and switch" with my room
review: My needs are limited but the timing of my visits is not usually predictable very far in advance. In addition to the uncertainty of just when I need to be there, a few times, I have been able to complete my responsibilities in less time than I had antipated. Your staff has consistently gone out of their way to accommodate my requests for lodging and, on the occasional times I have needed to leave early, have graciously responded. They have never failed to respond promptly to my requests and to provide exactly what I sought. These comments apply equally to all of your staff with whom I have the pleasure to interact, both at the desk and through email and telephone.  Charles

title: The employees are the great equalizers
review: Dear Mr. Willard,    Thank you for taking the time to post your positive comments about our staff and hotel.  My team and I strive to satisfy our guests’ expectations each and every time they stay with us.  I have shared your warm comments with my staff and they are overjoyed! We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.    Kindest regards,   Rob Lewis General Manager

title: Friendly & capable front desk staff, clean property, centrally located. We had a great time!
review: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and I loved, loved my room...it had a balcony overlooking the pool, the bed was new and high and made to perfection...there was a nice couch....not so much for my next trip...  After being told my room was ready at 1pm, I arrived at 2:30 pm to check in and was informed my room was still not ready...how is that possible...but another room was available that was comprabile to the room I requested....when I got into the room I realized that I had been fooled...the room was not even close to being comprable to the room I requested....the bed was low to the ground and old with old bedding...and the balcony overlooked the side of a building....not the kind of one night stay I was planning...I was upset...I'm hoping next time I stay there they…

title: Could not have been better
review: What a grat hotel! Everyone was so professional, polite and had customer service down to a science. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Would recommend to anyone traveling to that area.

title: Not what I have come to expect from Marriott
review: If we hadn't arrived from out of town after a 5 hr drive  at 2am, we would have left and found another hotel.  I have been a Marriott club member since 2004 and up until now wouldn't have even considered staying elsewhere.  I reserved a king room with a sofabed for a late arrival.  We didn't get one!  This would have been ok with TWO QUEEN beds.  I was travelling with a friend not someone I wished to share the same bed with.  It was the smallest hotel room I have ever been in and of course there was no sofabed.  The shower drain backed up in less than two minutes which I reported to the front desk on Saturday morning and nothing was ever done about it.  Oh last but not least, when I went to get coffee (without purchasing breakfast) I asked for milk and was told that I had to…

title: Good Hotel, pleasant employees
review: This was a decent hotel. Relatively clean, good employees that were polite. Location was good from the beach and other restaurants. If you have to take a taxi, be absolutely sure you have your GPS working on your phone or look up the route BEFORE you get in. Taxi drivers were terrible with trying to take us out of our way to raise the price. Walking to the beach is not out of the question if you're in any kind of decent shape. If not it's about 1.2 miles away. Your best bet is to just rent a car. Breakfast in the morning was good. There is an all-you-can-eat buffet for $10 per person. They have a chef cook fresh eggs/omelets the way you want them. Do yourself one favor, do not get a hotel room that faces Federal Drive. All we heard were police sirens and muscle cars. Pool is ok,…

title: Perfect getaway residence
review: I had been to Fort Lauderdale many times, but this time decided to stay in a hotel.  The Courtyard is centrally located, close to many restaurants, and in a safe and scenic area.

title: Excellent Stay!
review: I was veyr pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room. The extra sink, and mini refrigerator were a nice touch. The only other item I would have liked was perhaps a small microwave.

title: Our stay was generally satisfactory.
review: I reserved two rooms prior to our stay.  I would have preferred to have had the rooms in closer proximity to each other.  One room was far superior to the other, in terms of location, one was on the fourth floor (exterior) and one was on the fifth floor (interior).  The fifth floor (interior) room was less enjoyable than the other.  It overlooked the roof of the office and the TV was older.  The exterior room was sunny and had a newer appearance. In the future, when I register for two rooms at the same time, I would appreciate that the rooms be adjacent.  I'm sure most folks would prefer the same!

title: Couldn't Have Been Better
review: JUst a quick note to say thank you...everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome and accommodate our needs....Elaine at the front is exceptional...as are the friendly housekeeping ladies....will be back soon and recommend to my friends....

title: Ideal location!
review: Located on corner of US 1, very close to Wilton Manor. The staff are very friendly and accommodating.

title: Good clean affordable place to stay
review: We were at the beginning of our road trip and stayed at this hotel for one night.  This is a nice and affordable hotel in a good location with free parking and a nice pool in the courtyard.  Close to the airport and walking distance to the beach.   Our room was on the 2nd floor with balcony and partial view of the pool.  The room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  Even though this hotel is situated at the corner of a busy intersection, we heard no noise from the street in our room.  It was such a beautiful day we decided to walk to the beach, about a 20-30 minute walk.  Commercial Blvd. leads you directly to the beach and to the seaside area know as Lauderdale By-The-Sea. Very nice indeed!!  You are surrounded by restaurants, bars, shops and some very nice outdoor facilities. …

title: just what we need it
review: The location its great, its very easy to find the hotel and the room was impecable. So i realli recommend this hotel if you are in a family trip....

title: Fantastic stay at this location.
review: My husband and I completed our week long honeymoon with a two night stay at this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the cleanliness was amazing. The location of the hotel offered many options for food and was located only 15-20 from malls and shopping district. Would highly recommend for other travellers.

title: Excellent property, well managed, great value
review: I have been staying at this property for several years. The property is well managed, really nice rooms, helpful staff and priced right. The staff is helpful, breakfast is really good and the pool and exercise room are very nice. The terrific location tops it off.

title: Do NOT stay at this place
review: This is a revamped ex HoJo. Looks like the early 70's, feels like being in a museum. Unfriendly, unqualified staff. Was charge higher rate than shown on confirmation ($17 higher). When complaining about this upon check-out, the frontdesk person wanted to give a refund of only $ 11 ! Took some time for her to figure out that it should be $ 17 plus taxes. One light inside room did not work. Maintenance guy found that one of the 2 extension cords to the light was unplugged. Why do they need 2 cords??

title: excellent
review: Dear Foodie421, Thank you for your response. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay.  The Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East was in deed converted, according to Courtyard Brand standards, from a Howard Johnson, and this is why our rooms have dual vanity areas, and are larger and more spacious than most new constructions.  After researching why your confirmation and the system had two different rates, we found that since you made your reservation, the rate at which you had reserved you room had increased. When performing an internal transaction, the system read the new rate instead of your original rate and that is what was charged. I can understand how frustrating this could have been and I apologize for not noticing ahead of time.  We are glad our staff was able to correct the rate difference when it was brought to their attention.  Through your valuable feedback we have conducted training with the Maintenance and Housekeeping Departments reinforcing the need to ensure that everything in the room, is always working properly.   If I can provide further assistance to you in the future, please feel free to contact me directly at cy.fllcy.gm@marriott.com   Sincerely, Rob Lewis

title: One of the worst hotels I've stayed at
review: Thanks courtyard for making my anniversary have a great start.  We did a pre cruise package and stayed at the Courtyard Marriott.   The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  They assisted me with transportation arrangements to and from the ship.   Very prompt and  efficent.

title: Another Great Stay
review: I have been staying at this Courtyard 8-10 times per year for the past 7 years and they have never disappointed.  Great staff, courteous and helpful service, outstanding breakfast and really appreciate the breakfast included with the AT&T rate- great way to start the day.

title: Convenient location
review: Dear Noags015,  Your kind words just warm our hearts! Thank you for your loyalty – we consider it the highest compliment! Wishing you joy and prosperity during this Holiday Season and New Year!   Warmest regards,  Rob Lewis General Manager  Courtyard by Marriott Fort Lauderdale East

title: We felt very well and free! The black cook was a bit unfriendly and unpleasant. Because of this he got no tip!
review: This hotel was centrally located to many of the things we wanted to do in Ft Lauderdale; beach, shopping, golf, dining.  Breakfast staff was great, friendly, tasty omelets.  Nice to have a fridge in the room.  Nice size rooms in general, everything in working order.

title: Great Hotel, but a little far from downtown.
review: It would be very nice sometimes to change and to add the breakfast. For example the fruits and bagels and  plain yoghurt and so on.

title: Value for Money
review: Pros: Great room in general. Free Parking and wi-fi connection.   Cons: A little far from Fort Laudardale Downtown.

title: Nice hotel in an average location
review: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriot for one night before our cruise and one night after our cruise. It wasn't too far from the cruise port and about a 10 or 15 minute walk from the beach. There was not a lot of food choice near the hotel except for a Denny's. Breakfast at the hotel was really good and the rooms were clean and big and perfectly nice. There was free wi-fi as well which was a plus. The pool was pretty average though.

title: Started out Great.....
review: Dear Michelle444,  I am so pleased that you and your travel companion enjoyed your pre and post cruise stay at our hotel.  I was delighted to hear that you complimented our all-you-can-eat Breakfast Buffet, spacious rooms and complimentary Wi-Fi.  If there is any way we can make your next stay more enjoyable, (perhaps recommendations to our favorite nearby restaurants within a 1 mile radius) please do contact me.  On behalf of the entire team, we are looking forward to welcoming you back to The Fort Lauderdale area soon.  Don’t forget that Oasis of The Sea and The Allure both depart from Port Everglades Cruise Port this winter!

title: Better than I expected
review: My mother and I checked into this hotel the night before her spinal surgery at Holy Cross hospital around the corner.  They have special rates for hospital patients/family.  Check in was great and everything was going well!   Hotel is clean.  Breakfast bar is decent (I didn't rush down the 2nd morning, but it wasn't bad).  Pool and hottub are clean, as well as the small gym area. All was great until my 3rd night.  After 2 very long days at the hospital, I came back to the hotel to have some dinner and relax.  I watched some TV and then decided to get ready for bed, as I was exhausted. I went to the washroom, took out my contacts and placed them in the "basket" type holder that comes with the Clear Care cleaning solution that I use.  The solution and holder MUST be used together…

title: Not bad at all--Definitely Would Recommend.
review: Travel to FL often and typically stay at the beach at the nicer resorts and hotels.  This trip was short and on a budget so I chose a travelocity package.  This hotel is clean and was updated in the past few years. Free wireless internet worked great, big balcony, cold AC, comfortable bed.  Double  vanity sink, granite counters, compact bath with original tile that was dated but  clean and well maintained.  No flat panel tv but no big deal.  The front desk was accomodating when I requested a room with higher floor.  4th floor room overlooking the pool and toward the beach skyline was quiet with the sliding door closed even though it is at a major intersection.  They have free computers to use in lobby with printers and made a few copies for me for free without hesitation.  They…

title: Clean, Comfortable and Great Friendly Staff
review: Recently stayed here for a long weekend while visiting a friend in the area.  This was my first time in Fort Lauderdale, having been to Miami many times over the past 10 years.  The hotel was clean, very convenient drive to the beach, and the pool was not bad and better than I expected.  The flat screen LCD television and free WiFi was a nice bonus.  We had two double beds and the rate was extremely reasonable.  I would recommend for families, friends, and anyone else looking for a place when visiting locals, or a place close to, but not right on the beach.  I believe we walked to the beach in about 20 minutes which was nice.  I would request a pool side room if available.  I believe there are only four.

title: Did the job!
review: We were at this Marriott for a one night pre cruise stay - they were under reno's but not an inconvenience.  Breakfast was good - staff friendly and helpful - room was good too - i thought price was steep at 200 bucks for one night, no complaints really but really was just a bit better than average hotel - just found it a little expensive that's all

title: Good and clean hotel with friendly staff
review: Good clean hotel with friendly staff (especially breakfast staff). Very clean. Some works were underway when we were there but no real inconvenience. Hi speed internet free of charge.

title: Average hotel.. fine for a couple of nights ...
review: We stayed 2 nights pre-cruise.  Hotel and room were clean.  Check in was okay.  Free internet.  Room had a balcony.  Would have been nice to have chairs on the balcony. I found it fine for a couple of nights, but I don't think I'd stay any longer than this.  Breakfast was good, not great.  Near a busy intersection, so expect noise when at the pool or if you have your window open.  Would consider staying here again if I got a good rate.

title: Not Bad But Definately Missing Something
review: The rooms were clean and updated but the hallways were dark and dreary. The room doors were old and not soundproof. This was the first Marriott I have been to where I could actually hear every noise in adjacent rooms. The AC units were being replaced so a large part of the hotel was not occupied. The AC unit in my room did a poor job and it smelled stale. I did report this but it never changed. The balconies were really large but without furniture. The breakfast buffet was good and the staff was wonderful. Worth noting is the pool which was larger and more resort like than most Courtyards. I might return when back in the area for business but the Coral Springs Courtyard, though further from Fort Lauderdale, is far superior.

title: Excellent Service, Terrific Staff!!
review: I must tell you, I sincerely enjoyed my stay, which by the way, was my first Marriott hotel stay.  I was very pleased.    I helped my best friend relocate to the Fort Lauderdale area.  We had driven all night (a little over 16 hours), so you know I was in a funk from moving furniture, driving, and more moving.  When I got to the hotel, which was at 1 p.m., I prayed they had a room available.  I walked up to the front desk, looked around feeling so out of place because the hotel was so nice and clean and I know I stank and smelled like a hobo....lol, and the two women at the front desk, one named Sharon, greeted me with a warm smile.  I was afraid they'd tell me I'd have to wait.  To my surprise, my room was ready.  YAY!    The room was very spacious.  There was a king size bed…

title: in disrepair
review: There was a general lack of maintenance. The elevators were out of service for TWO DAYS. The only way to get to the room and back was up and down a very hot and  dirty staircase.  All the carpets stank and walking barefoot made my feet dirty.   Someone needs to CLEAN the carpets, not just vacuum them which just spreads around the funk. They won't change your sheets unless you request it.  I figured this out after four days!

title: good value, clean, safe
review: Liked the 5th floor overlooking the pool. Good value for the price if looking for something in this location.

title: Lots of room...for improvements!
review: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for a little over 2 weeks, and I can't say it would ever become a favorite. While the room we stayed in was spacious and had some of the usual amenities one would expect (tv, radio/alarm clock, phone), there were a couple of oddities. The mini-fridge was definitely great to have and worked like a charm, but having it in a cabinet becomes annoying after a day or so - and the lack of microwave means you really DO have to get out whenever you want something to eat. The a/c unit seemed old and not in the best working order - even at the highest setting, the room barely got cool. The first week, we had to make several complaints at the front desk because we woke up one morning to find that we'd gotten tiny little bites all over our feet;…

title: Great Service!
review: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and the pool area was nice!

title: A very pleasant experience achieved by great personnel and facilities
review: Great loaction and wait staff.  Price was outstanding compaared to the facilities and staff available.   All requested services were completed with a smile and promply.  Easy parking and close to the beach.

title: It's like coming home
review: When we came back from a Cruise the words I said to Sharon "It's like Coming Home" It is such a relaxing place and the employees are so friendly and can't do enough. Definitely one of our better places to stay.

title: Excellent service and an accomadating staff
review: I have for the second year in a row a great experience at your property. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the facilities are well maintained. The morning breakfast staff again made us feel like we were at home. I did find out in seeing guests paying for breakfast with a voucher/coupon that next year I will include breakfast in my rate or use my Maariott Rewards points to pay for bereakfasts. In fact when I asked at the front desk, I was provided with a coupon.  That is excellent service and the staff should be proud! Wonderful

title: Location of the Hotel is Very Good
review: The location ot the hotel is very good, far from seashore, good for relaxing, but the front avenue is very noisy.

title: Nice, friendly and well located
review: If you're looking for a clean, well run hotel near the Ft. Lauderdale shore, this might be your choice.  Right at the corner of US 1 and Commercial, this is close, moderately priced and has staff that have been there for a while.  We've used this hotel 4 times in the past year and was impressed each time with how friendly and well run the hotel seems to be.  We see the same staff time and again and they remember us!  That is so nice.  And it is less than 5 minutes to the beach and a similar amount to I-95.  You need a car but that is the only down side.  Free parking and free internet are a big plus.

title: Accommodating
review: My family & I stayed at the Courtyard a week ago. We arrived at the hotel late around 2am and were told all they had available at the time would be a king size bed. We had no choice but to take the room for the night. The front desk was very helpful though in getting a rollaway bed for my 6 yeard old and a crib for my 2 year old. I went to the front desk the next morning to change to a double and they already knew about the situation and we just had to wait for a room to be cleaned.  The double room was just fine except the fridge didnt work which they quickly replaced. All in all good service from the front desk.  The pool was fine with a nice seating area. The noise from busy Commercial Blvd was a bit much but what do you expect next to a busy intersection.  Location was just…

title: A great place to stay
review: Excellent experience.  Very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable front desk staff.  Great breakfast served by very friendly staff.  Would return in a flash.

title: Comfortable - except for the odor in the room
review: The room had a fstrong smell - probably mildew.  We didn't complain because we were so tired and only there for several hours.  Otherwise everything was fine.

title: Always a positive experience with each stay
review: I Been a regular at this hotel for the past 15 years, always clean rooms, love free internet, friendly staff. overall convenient to major highways, airport, excellent restaurants in the area. Feels like being home!

title: Great customer service, good location and price
review: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each day and the afternoon happy hour. The hotel was convenient to all activities. The rooms were very clean and look very new. We were very happy with the value for our money. Excellent experience.

title: Great experience away from home
review: I stayed at this hotel for a one year period in 2008 while working for FEMA.  The stay was as usual with most Marriott Facilities, absolutely great; however, this hotel was exceptional in every way.  The staff, and in particular, Veronica, constantly asked the important questions and responded in a positive manner for all the various needs I required for personal and business needs.  I will use this facility in the future whenever in the area.  I have and will always recommend this facility to friends and co-workers.

title: Great pool and clean rooms!
review: We stayed for just one night at the Courtyard Fort Lauderdale East after our cruise returned, and we received a wonderful room. (I guess booking early is a good thing.) Our room was right next to the pool (about 20 steps to the water), and was very nice and clean (as it typical of most all Marriott hotel rooms). We received an early check-in and the staff was very accomodating to our needs, including recommending a great pizza place.  The only negative about this property is that it can be quite loud at times while you are out by the pool trying to relax. It is at the corner of a major intersection, and there always seemed to be some motorcycle or hotrod revving up their engines outside or peeling out.  Other than that, the stay and the hotel were great with one exception. This…

title: Wow, A Total Package.
review: Great Location cloce to the beach and great dining i recomend Seawatch for dinner.  The staff was very nice. The rooms were imaculate, It is Marriott. The grounds are well manicured and clean.

title: Close to the airport and comfortable
review: My mother and I stayed here March 20-23 to visit my sister and her kids.  The kids had a great time hanging out at the pool when we decided to stay in and the adults did as well.  We found the rooms to be clean and the housekeeping to be exceptional.  The only recommendation I would have is the balcony needs outdoor seats.  We ate at the breakfast bar one morning...for $10 it was very good.  The gentleman at the omelette station was very hospitable and the made us an excellent breakfast.  The beach is 1.5 miles away...a bit of a walk for us but accessible by car.  Some reviews complained about the hotel being by a busy highway; our room was on the same side as the highway and it by no means affected our sleep.  If you need a hotel close to the airport in a safe neighborhood, I…

title: Perfect for a night
review: We stayed here for a night on our way down to the Keys.  The hotel was clean, and they staff was helpful in finding a place for us to order pizza and local attractions.  Room was clean and comfortable, and had a balcony overlooking the parking lot.  In the morning, the breakfast buffet was great, as well as the cooked to order omelets.  However, nothing was free.  Overall, a good experience, we would stay here again.

title: Ants in bed, not clean!
review: Stayed for 2 nights and we were thankful that we didn't have to stay any longer.   On the 2nd night, when we got home late, I discovered something that looked like sand in my bed sheets. I later went through the pillows and discovered a large trail of ant tracks on the back of the pillows! I was horrified, which later explained the bites I got on the back of my neck.  This is expected in a 3rd world country, or a lower end hotel chain. The hotel is poorly managed. Plus the odour of the room made it unpleasant as soon as you came in.  I believe this used to be a smoking hotel and recently changed to non-smoking, but they didn't do a good job of eliminating the stinch.   The bathroom had molds in the corner and could have been easily cleaned if housekeeping payed attention to…

title: Great location, comfortable and clean.
review: Stayed april 4th - 8th..  Very comfortable room.. I had 2 sinks.. one out and one inside the bathroom which makes it very convenient. The room had a small fridge, free Internet (ethernet cable is provided in a small bag in the closet). The TV had basic cable. It seemed the room had recent renovation work. The location is excellent right on the corner of US-1 (N Federal Hwy) and Commercial Blvd which makes it very easy to get to.. just 3-4 minutes east of I-95. Ample free parking is provided. I got it on Priceline for $60 a night.

title: Watch Out!
review: Stayed at this property about 2 weeks ago for 2 nights.  The room had a funny odor.  I think it was mold!  Also there was no outdoor furniture on most balconies.  I had a view of the pool and could not even enjoy it.  I would not recommend this property to anyone.

title: Not impressive
review: Stayed there for one evening with our 2 kids before leaving for the airport.  I did not have the same positive experience shared by other posters; maybe that had to do with the fact that we had our young kids with us.  This is not a family friendly hotel, in my opinion.  It is off of a major thoroughfare, Federal Hwy, and the area is not particularly appealing.  The hotel staff was courteous and professional.    In comparison to other Courtyard Marriotts we have stayed in, this building appears aged in many ways.  The pool was nothing to write home about, but my perspective may have been tainted by the folks in the hot tub who had a few cases of beer with them and used this as their personal party headquarters.  The room had a stale smell, despite the fact that we had a balcony…

title: Nice little layover hotel
review: We stayed at the Courtyard for one night before heading down to South Beach. The room was newly renovated with a nice bathroom. It was clean, safe and comfortable. It met my expectations as a repeat Courtyard customer. Our rate included the breakfast buffet in the morning, which had made to order omelets and waffles. At breakfast, many of the other patrons were getting ready to catch a cruise, so it seems like a good layover between the airport and the rest of your time in Florida. The hotel is right off of US 1. We didn't notice any highway noise, but I'm not a light sleeper.

title: Pleasant Stay
review: I stayed here for one night.  Location was great and there was a Denny's Restuarant across the street.  Check- in was quick and staff were friendly.  Room was very clean and was fairly large.  Room also had a mini fridge and a large desk.  Parking was free and plenty of spaces were available.  Pool was also large and clean.  I would recommend this hotel strongly.

title: No Problems Here
review: Nice staff and well maintained rooms here, typical of the Courtyard brand.  Check-in was smooth and efficiient and everything worked well.  Location is convenient and there's a Denny's Restaurant just across the street.  It's off-season now so hotel is quiet and value is great.  Recommended.

title: During our tour of Florida
review: During our tour of Florida we stayed at this hotel for a long weekend.  I was so pleased with everything about this hotel, it was clean, professional and its location was fantastic.  We got given a ground floor room with terrace on the pool front which was absolutley fab! Great for night dips, drinking wine and taking a dip in the hot tub!  A truly fab hotel, great price and just out of the hustle and bustle!  A*

title: Great value, very nice time
review: I stayed at this property last week for five (5) nights for a softball tournament.  I had researched extensively and paid $40 a night on Priceline.  Website rate was $119, but if you were a Marriott member you could (and still can) get the weekend nights for $65.  While I mainly used the hotel to crash, I would like to point out the following amenities:  Free Parking Free High Speed Internet (including a computer in the lobby to use) Free Fruit and Coffee in lobby Refrigerator in room Free in room safe Laundry room- Free soap Workout room-Universal, some cardio Pool and hot tub.  Room (504) large and clean two double beds and chair. All rooms have balconies.  I was on top floor, facing parking lot (as advised on Trip Advisor) and did not hear a thing.  Would stay there again in…

title: Nothing special, but it wasn't bad
review: A family member who lives in Ft. Lauderdale booked us this room and did so b/c it was cheap. If the choice had been mine, I would have spent the additional $$ to enjoy my hotel a little more. This place was nothing special. The staff was friendly -- but not overly helpful or sympathetic, especially when we received a loud knock on our door for a 7:30 a.m. wake-up call that we did not ask for (their phones had gone out and we were mysteriously on their wake-up list).   Our room was clean, but again, nothing special. It faced the pool and the door to the balcony was difficult to open. And since the pool is "roadside," the street noise is noticeable. The rooms on the other side face the parking lot, but might be a little quieter.  Breakfast is a tad expensive for what they offer…

title: Nice hotel -- comfortable
review: After desperately looking for a decent hotel room around the Miami airport after a late arriving flight, I broadened my search to Ft. Lauderdale. Using priceline, I found the Courtyard by Marriot for $75. Checkin was a breeze (pleasant receptionist and all) and room was spotless.

title: No Issues
review: I thought this hotel was fine.  The room was big, the room clean and it looked like everything had just been updated and/or renovated.  The bed was very comfortable.  THe room had a nice feature of a 2nd sink outside the bathroom.  It was not a far drive to eat and the location put it about 10 minutes from the airport when we were driving there early in the morning.

title: Screwed up my reservation!
review: I stayed here for one night prior to a 10-day cruise to the Caribbean.  The hotel itself was comfortable, with the rooms decently furnished and very reasonably priced ($79/night during Thanksgiving weekend).  The only major problem with the room was the bathtub did not drain properly, leaving about 6 inches of dirty water after a 10 minute shower.  I had to use the ice bucket and dump the water in the sink to allow a second person to use the shower after me.  The biggest complaint I had was that the hotel screwed up my reservation.  I was traveling with a male friend (I'm female) that I am not in a relationship with and did NOT want to share a room with him.  So I had deliberately looked for a well-priced hotel where we could easily justify separate rooms.  Unfortunately instead…

title: Not great
review: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone we met here was bright and bubbly and well informed. A pity, then, that the room we were in felt so tired and shabby. Thankfully the glazing kept road noise to a minimum but the beds felt close to the end of their days. The bathroom needed a good clean (to remove someone else's pubic hairs from the bathtub) but we didn't bother to mention this to the front desk as we had just spent 9 hours on a flight to Miami followed by 2 hours waiting in line at immigration and we were exhausted. When we asked for directions to restaurants on the beach we were told by the front desk that it would be a ten minute walk. We fancied a drink so we left the car behind and walked for 30 minutes (briskly, and we are both over 6 feet tall so…

title: July 4th Weekend
review: I just stayed at this hotel over the July 4th weekend. I did all the hotel arrangements through Marriot's website. I recieved a fantastic rate in conjunction with my AAA auto club discount. Location of hotel is on a major intersection (Commercial Blvd. and US1). ***The hotel is not near the beach. There is restaurant in the hotel and a Denny's across the street. Rooms are large, very clean with a modern upscale decor (finally no pastels!!!). Beds are very comfortable, down pillows. There is cable TV, pay per view movies and a Bose wave alarm clock radio. In addition, there is a in-room coffee maker, small refrigerator, iron and a wall safe. ***Highly recommend getting a room facing the back parking lot, otherwise you will be subject to constant road noise. The only turn-off was…

title: Great place: close to beach, real friendly staff, computer friendly place
review: We enjoyed our stay at this Courtyard Marriott in Ft. Lauderdale.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious.   I particularly liked the firm mattresses.  So often  Florida hotels  have mattresses that are worn out.   This hotel is tech friendly with free computer/internet access for laptops. Few hotels go out of their way to accomodate guests like this one. I needed a few more pillows and within 2 minutes I had 4 more.  Staffing is one of the best qualities. Breakfast is hearty and worth the $8.   If you enjoy swimming, the pool is great.
